subject: Re: Problem with Method which is expected to throw message
msgSnippet: Thanks to all who tried to help, The problem is solved. Actually test was running under junit3 runner due to this line ... MockObjectTestCase is extending
messageBody:
Thanks to all who tried to help,

The problem is solved. Actually test was running under junit3 runner
due to this line

> public class testBoolTypeHandler extends MockObjectTestCase {

MockObjectTestCase is extending TestCase hence it was using jUnit3.

I removed that clause and modified the whole class accordingly.
The test is running fine as expected going GREEN in spite of exception.
The working code is given below for somebody who may stumble like me.

thanks and regards

Raja.


public class testBoolTypeHandler {

private Mockery context;
private ResultGetter getter;
private ParameterSetter setter;
private boolTypeHandlerTF boolHandler;

@Before
public void setUp() throws Exception {

context = new JUnit4Mockery();
getter = context.mock(ResultGetter.class);
setter = context.mock(ParameterSetter.class);
boolHandler = new boolTypeHandlerTF();

context.checking(new Expectations() {
{
atLeast(1).of(getter).getString();
will(onConsecutiveCalls(returnValue("T"), returnValue("F"), returnValue(" ") // , returnValue('F')
));
}
});
}

@After
public void tearDown() throws Exception {}

@Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
public void testGetResult() throws SQLException {

boolean result;

result = ((Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter))).booleanValue();
assertEquals("getter.getString() == 'T' ", true, result);

result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
assertEquals("getter.getString() == 'F' ", false, result);

// getter.getString() == ' ' Throws Exception
result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));

}

/**
* @Test
* public void testSetParameter() {
* fail("Not yet implemented");
* }
*
* @Test
* public void testValueOf() {
* fail("Not yet implemented");
* }
*/
}
